means: 奉献(dedicate的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: Virginia was still struggling to be a conscientious and dedicated mother.
sentence.Network_cn: 弗吉尼娅还在尽力成为一位勤勤恳恳、全心奉献的母亲。

sentence.Network_en: Chiswick church is dedicated to St Nicholas, patron saint of sailors.

entry.tran: 献身的;一心一意的;热忱的
entry.def: You use dedicated to describe someone who enjoys a particular activity very much and spends a lot of time doing it.

example.ex: Her great-grandfather had clearly been a dedicated and stoical traveller.
example.tran: 她的曾祖父显然是一位非常投入而且坚忍不拔的旅行爱好者。
古典音乐的忠实追随者

entry.tran: 专用（于…）的;专门（为…而）设计制造的
entry.def: You use dedicated to describe something that is made, built, or designed for one particular purpose or thing.

example.ex: Such areas should also be served by dedicated cycle routes.
example.tran: 这些区域也应该设专门的自行车道。

example.ex: ...the world's  first museum dedicated to ecology.
example.tran: 世界上第一个专门的生态博物馆

means.word_mean: 1. devoted to a cause or ideal or purpose;

sentences.sentence: "dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal"- A.Lincoln

means.word_mean: 2. solemnly dedicated to or set apart for a high purpose;

sentences.sentence: "a chapel dedicated to the dead of World War II"

auth_sentence.content: Doreen is the least experienced player but totally dedicated.

Sentence.sentence: Smith has written a breezy guidebook, with a series of short chapters dedicated to specific aspects of urbanity - parks, say, or the various schemes that have been put forward over the years for building the perfect city.

sentences.en: His whole life is dedicated to scientific research.
sentences.cn: 他毕生致力于科学研究。

sentences.en: His whole energies are dedicated to improve the design.
sentences.cn: 他的全部精力都放在改进这项设计上了。
